events.name: BuildHub #3 - 3D Modelling CAD Workshop in Zen Monk Mode
events.description: ​Have the knack to design your own mechanical products and 3D print them? Unsure where to start? Fear not.​​​HI! I'mSuraj Kumarand I can teach you how to become a maker in five days. I was the Chief Engineer of Sherpy, a drone startup that manufactured small, long-range airplanes for commercial delivery (sherpymedia.com). I now founded a neurotech startup (Cerelog.com).There are a lot of visionaries and hackers around in New York City, but materializing an idea can be quite the wall to climb! What are the real-world constraints to pay attention to when designing something? Where's the space where you can build things fast and get great advice?!​​This is a small-group, high attention workshop, targeting 10 creative people who have the itch to create things.Light on theory, heavy on practice!​​WHAT YOU'LL DO​​Get familiar with Fusion360!​​​​Design your own custom spray bottle using Fusion360. Use it for cleaning around your house/pranking your dog!​​​​We provide the nozzle and tube—you design the rest!​​​​3D print your creation on the high performance Bambu X1 Carbon printer​​​​DETAILS​​​​Five-day workshop (~3 hrs per session)​​Mon - Fri​​​​Professional guidance from an experienced engineer​​​​Learn to navigate Fusion360 and think like a designer​​​​REGISTRATION​​​$100 / person for the 4 days​​​​Limited spots available​​​​Reserve your seat today!​​Your Host:​​​​Suraj Kumar, Mechanical Engineer with years of Fusion360 experience​​​​*thank you tofractal techfor hosting us!*Contact at surajratnam99@gmail.com

events.name: Hardware Meetup #1 @ Fractal Tech
events.description: ​NYC Hardware Builders MeetupI started this meetup for two reasons: the hardware scene in NYC is growing fast, and it deserves a tight-knit, high-quality community. I want everyone building real things—whether that’s embedded systems, wearables, neurotech, robotics, or RF—to actually know each other. The existing meetups haven’t quite hit the mark, so we’re building something better.​Join a community of engineers, inventors, and builders shaping the future of hardware. Whether you’re debugging a prototype, bringing up a custom board, or just love the smell of solder in the morning, this is your scene.​Bring your projects, ideas, or just curiosity. Bonus points if you bring something you built.

events.name: Tea Conversations : Steeped in History
events.description: ​Hi friends!​Welcome to Solei, a social teahouse concept that connects people from different walks of life.​It is your third place, your city’s living room, where we sit down to talk to one another beyond small talk over a shared cup of tea and some traditional Chinese tea cakes.​We had a lovely time last time: see herehttps://lu.ma/jo03fi5land herehttps://www.instagram.com/p/DIJmgrXOByF/​—​What to expect:​Arrival (~15min):You’ll be sat down in a group as you arrive while the host serves you tea. We will be sharing with you the story of the tea and tea cakes.​Conversations (~75min):Chat with the group over tea in a semi-structured manner (depending on the group size, we’ll either speak as one group or break down into smaller groups). We’ll also come together as a group to get to know who’s in the room.​Free flows (~30min):Grab more tea and have amazing conversations.​—​This is one of the many pop-up events to come. And I hope you have an amazing experience. Your ticket includes tea refills and tea cakes.​Dress comfortably (you may need to sit on the floor) and bring your lovely self. Try to come on time (or early), if you are running late send a note to the host via Luma!​Looking forward to meeting you,​Coco​​If you’re curious on why we’re doing this and the story behind this initiative, read this blog post:Slow Spaces for Conversation.​Our website:http://dearsolei.com/​If you cannot make this one, sign uphereor follow us (IG/X) to be in the loop for the next ones!

events.name: Sfânt's Spring Revelry
events.description: ​Event​Join us atSfânt's Spring Revelryas we expand to a new, much bigger space for our 5th popup! Soak up the spring sunshine on the rooftop, enjoy a cozy corner with a book on the living room's couches, or find collaborators to aid you on your latest sidequest.​What is Sfânt?​Sfânt is a popup cafe serving modern coffee and tea beverages. All profits are donated to charity. We feature frequent collaborators, such as pastry chefs, ambiance engineers, and tattoo artists.Come learn about coffee and enjoy some, might we say, excellent beverages!See our last popup's recap on ourInstagram.​Menu​Emily, fresh from her stint as a pastry chef at Momoya, has something special baking for this event.​For coffee, we're brewing up something extraordinary for this celebration... it involves some snazzyclarification:O ;)

events.name: The Forever Library: A FarCon Side Event at Fractal
events.description: ​A literary event and pop-up book fair during FarCon NYC (farcon.nyc), uniting writers, readers, and builders in a global celebration of books, culture, and onchain storytelling.​Come by for:​Literary themed beverages.​A curation of physical and digital fiction, nonfiction, poetry, and zines by authors and publishers in the Farcaster ecosystem.​A selection of books curated by Well Read.​Poetry performance art.​Giveaways of rare print books and onchain limited digital editions.​Book swap.​Communal zine-making.​& more!​Authors, please reach out to Amelie (amelie@alexandriabooks.com) if you'd like to showcase your work as part of the event!​Featuring:​Alexandria Labs (alexandriabooks.com), the Library of Alexandria for onchain books​Debbie Soon, Singaporean author of Digital Mavericks (Wiley) and co-founder ofthehug.xyz(acq. by Art Domains)​Phil Mohun, founder of Bright Moments,amps.fun, and Node Foundation--and creator of the /books channel on Farcaster!​Well Read (https://wellread.pt/), a bilingual art & design bookstore, event space and meeting place located in Lisbon, Portugal

events.name: Sunday Session | NY AI
events.description: ​Join us forNew York AI's Sunday Session, a space to build, collaborate, and connect with the city's AI community.​We'll start working at noon, then wind down with dinner and socializing in the evening.Schedule:• 12:00 PM – Doors Open - Build & Collaborate• 5:30 PM – Dinner & Social Time• 7:00 PM – Doors CloseHosted by:Derek@New York AIJake@Fractal

events.name: How to Choose a Health Insurance Plan
events.description: ​The Fractal community aims to support its members across multiple facets of life - work, play, and now, health.​In this weeks event, we give a talk on how to choose a health insurance plan. The talk will help you answer questions like: What are premiums and deductibles? What's the difference between an HMO and PPO? How do I figure out if my doctor is covered by my insurance?​​After that chat, you can sign up for a free appointment with a nurse to get feedback on ongoing medical issues, prepare for an upcoming doctor's appointment, talk through lifestyle changes like diet or exercise, etc.​The US healthcare system is complex - we aim to make information about it, and how to navigate it, more digestible and accessible. To learn more about how it all works check out thisWiki.​​Disclaimer: This event is for informational and educational purposes only. The nurse will provide general health information and will not offer personal medical advice, diagnosis, or treatment. Please consult your own healthcare provider for medical guidance specific to your needs.

events.description: ​We're meeting up every Sunday afternoon this Spring to tend the garden on the roof of the Fractal Tech Hub (weather permitting).Bring snacks to share, supplies for the garden, plants to plant, or just bring yourself ready to be put to work.​​More information on the Fractal Garden Website:http://garden.fractaltechhub.com/

events.name: O&O Meetup: Forecasting & Prediction Markets with Jordan Rubin
events.description: ​Optima & Outliersorganizing another evening of drinks and discussion on May 5 at Fractal Tech in Williamsburg.This time, we're excited to haveJordan Rubinlead a conversation on Forecasting. Jordan’s background is in quantitative finance - he was previously Senior VP at Two Sigma. For this discussion, he’ll be drawing from his experience advising the online forecasting platform, Metaculus. Jordan will frame the discussion around answering questions like: Who should use forecasts? What makes forecasts more or less valuable? How should one consumer forecasts?The evening will include a brief welcome, the forecasting discussion, and unstructured time to mingle. Beers and snacks provided. Feel free to bring additional beverages to share.Best,​Vaishnav

events.name: Maximum New York May Party & Abundance Politics Accelerator
events.description: ​Come hang out with friends, hear some lightning talks about NYC city/state politics, find collaborators for your own political schemes, and have a good time!​You'll enjoy the company of MNY alumni, people from theabundance movementgenerally, and other guests.​There will be drinks and snacks!​Know before you arrive:This event will be guided by thefour rules of etiquettethat guide all Maximum New York classes, and is generally for people who mostly agree withThe Sensible Seventy.
